result.execSummary:
The defendant David Francis Knechtges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Francis Knechtges is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Francis Knechtges was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine is $1494.00 with $100.00 cash bond applied, balance due 60 days or pay plan.
DNA surcharge of $200.00 due 60 days or pay plan.
Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Sentence may be served in Dane County.  May serve sentence on EMP through Dane county ATIP.

chargeModifiers.descr: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)

records.addlTxt: 2nd Amended Complaint-Count 2 amended to operating with restricted controlled substance in blood-3rd offense.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant David Francis Knechtges in court with attorney William Ginsberg.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard 15CM538 & 15CM626.  Defendant pleads guilty  to ct 1 and ct 4 in 15CM538.  Reading waived on amended complaint and defendant pleads guilty to ct 2 in amended complaint in 15CM626.  Court will adjudge guilty and enter JOC.  In  15CM538  Ct 1: 5 days jail with huber to run consecutive,  $1379.00, 12 month revocation and IID, $65.00 blood costs, AODA and follow through  DNA sample.  Ct 4: $243.00.    DIsmiss ct 2 & 3.  In 15CM626 amended complaint: count  2: 45 days jail with huber  $1694.00, 24 month revocation & IID, $65.00 blood draw, AODA & treatment. Ct 1 dismissed.    0 days jail credit in 15CM538 and  1  days jail credit in 15CM626.  Fine due 60 days or pay plan.  May serve in Dane County.  Sentence to commence today at 7:00 pm.  $100.00 cash to be applied to fine.  No objection to EMP program.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Ct 2:  Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance in Blood- 2nd offense.

Cases called: 15CM626 & 15CM538, Defendant David Francis Knechtges in court with attorney William Ginsberg.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant stood mute, Court entered not guilty pleas, jury trials to be set. Bond continued.

ADDRESS INFO for David Francis Knechtges

Prior: 822 E Edgewater Street, Portage, WI 53901
Letter with updated address and stating representation. Filed by Atty Bill Ginsberg - mail.
standard misdemeanor conditions, not operate motor vehicle w/out valid D.L.

Defendant David Francis Knechtges in court, in custody by video with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $100.00 cash bond, standard misdemeanor conditions, not operate motor vehicle w/out valid D.L.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
